alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:35PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Yavapai and Coconino Counties through 615 PM MST... At 534 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sedona to near Bridgeport. Movement was northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, heavy rainfall, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Page Springs, Cottonwood, Red Rock State Park, Dead Horse Ranch State Park and Tuzigoot National Monument. This includes State Route 89A between mile markers 357 and 371. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
